FY1920.Q81_4: Established a Unique Research Resource.  The RNA Epitranscriptomics and Proteomics Resource (REPR) was successfully established as a unique resource and transitioned to new leadership. We maintained, troubleshooted and repaired eight mass spectrometers including Bruker FT-ICR, Waters IMS-MS, Thermo Orbitrap Velos, Agilent 6120, Agilent QTOF 6530, Sciex 6500 QTRAP, Sciex QSTAR XL, and Waters TQ-S.
FY1920.Q81_5: Outstanding Service and Productivity.  The RNA Epitranscriptomics and Proteomics Resource (REPR) serviced 38 Investigators and was included in 22 written projects, which include grant applications (9), grant awards (5) and published papers (8).
FY1920.Q81_6:
International Acclaim.  Work performed in The RNA Epitranscriptomics and Proteomics Resource (REPER) was accepted into the prestigious journal Nature (5-Year Impact Factor of 45).
